channel.title: Recommendations on Adam Cowley | Full Stack Developer specialising in Neo4j and Node JS
channel.description: Recent content in Recommendations on Adam Cowley | Full Stack Developer specialising in Neo4j and Node JS

item.title: WordPress Recommendations with Neo4j – Part 4: PageRank with APOC Procedures
item.description: This post is part of a series on building a recommendation engine with WordPress. If you haven’t already done so, check out the posts below: Part 1: Hooks & Data Modelling Part 2: Content Based Recommendations Part 3: Collaborative Filtering WordPress Recommendations with Neo4j – Part 4: PageRank with APOC Procedures PageRank with APOC Since the 3.0 release of Neo4j, the system has supported Procedures. Unlike Unmanaged Extensions which are called via the REST API, Procedures can be invoked directly through a cypher statement.

item.title: WordPress Recommendations with Neo4j – Part 2: Content Based Recommendations
item.description: This post is part of a series on building a recommendation engine with WordPress. If you haven’t already done so, check out the posts below: Part 1: Hooks & Data Modelling Part 2: Content Based Recommendations Part 3: Collaborative Filtering WordPress Recommendations with Neo4j – Part 4: PageRank with APOC Procedures Content Based Recommendations Now that we have some data in our Database, we can use the information to create recommendations for the user.
